Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To attempt something impossible or contradictory
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: To try to do something that cannot be done
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Mountain imagery; common across Kabyle regions
First Example Sentence: Yella-d yebɣa ad iselkem-d kra, iṭṭef adrar ɣef waman!
Second Example Sentence: Iṭṭef adrar ɣef waman, ur yezmir ara i d-yenna.
Third Example Sentence: Abrid-agi iṭṭef adrar ɣef waman, xas yebɣa tḥemmleḍ.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: A foolish person with power is dangerous
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Power in the hands of a fool is harmful
First Example Sentence: Ur ẓer ara, aḍeḥya d tigejdit n yimeṭṭawen, ad ttruɣ-d.
Second Example Sentence: Iḥekmen ɣef lwela, d tigejdit n yimeṭṭawen.
Third Example Sentence: Tamsaḥt tettwasrun, d aḍeḥya yebɣa yimeslayen.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To get away with something dishonestly or undeservedly
First Example Sentence: Yekkes abrid seg usekkur, ur iḥemmleḍ ula yisem.
Second Example Sentence: Yura-d akk, yekkes abrid seg usekkur!
Third Example Sentence: Nekkni nḥemmel ad nexdem, mačči ad nekks abrid seg usekkur.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Hope is the last thing that leaves a person
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Hope is the final thing a person loses
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Cultural emphasis on patience and hope
First Example Sentence: Ula ma ur yezmir, asirem d azemur i d-yeggi.
Second Example Sentence: Asirem i yella di wul-iw, d azemur i d-yeggi.
Third Example Sentence: Ur tefrak ara, asirem d azemur i d-yeggi.

Idiom (Kabyle): Ifeḍ aẓuɣer s tigejdit n tfuct
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To solve a small problem with excessive effort
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Overkill solution for a minor issue
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Rural metaphor: shooting a fly with a cannon
First Example Sentence: Ifeḍ aẓuɣer s tigejdit n tfuct, ur tzemreḍ ara ad d-nul.
Second Example Sentence: Ad yečča-d kra, ifeḍ aẓuɣer s tigejdit n tfuct.
Third Example Sentence: Mačči d wakk iḥemmleɣ – ifeḍ aẓuɣer s tigejdit n tfuct!

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To speak harshly or directly without tact
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Fire as metaphor for harsh speech
First Example Sentence: Yewweḍ awal s tafeɣt, ur iḥemmleḍ amkan n udiwenni.
Third Example Sentence: Ulac asefru, yewweḍ awal s tafeɣt!

Idiom (Kabyle): Afus ur yettwassel ara ɣef ubrid
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Help was not delivered on time
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Help came too late or not at all
First Example Sentence: Afus ur yettwassel ara ɣef ubrid, tella-d taɣiwant.
Second Example Sentence: Wur nessin, afus ur yettwassel ara ɣef ubrid.
Third Example Sentence: Ad yeggi tura, afus ur yettwassel ara ɣef ubrid.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Completely lacking common sense or decency
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Used widely in informal village settings

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Someone left without saying goodbye or completing their duty
First Example Sentence: Iṭṭfeɣ ur yesɛi ara, yufa-d tameṭṭut.
Second Example Sentence: Mačči am wakka, iṭṭfeɣ ur yesɛi ara.
Third Example Sentence: Abrid tura d arrac, iṭṭfeɣ ur yesɛi ara.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To feel shame or be embarrassed for one's behavior
First Example Sentence: Yeḥsem i ṭṭeḥma, ulac asefru ɣef wakka.
Third Example Sentence: Tzemreḍ ad t-twaliḍ, yeḥsem i ṭṭeḥma.
